page.title: 11Thirty Years Of Change.
page.content: Kennethmont has changed greatly over the past 30 years. The roads have been much improved to suit the needs of modern traffic, being wider, straighter and better surfaced. A more mobile population has meant that people now tend to do most of their shopping in the larger centres where they have more choice so there are now fewer shops locally. Farming has been mechanised and modernised,resulting in fewer workers on the land where many workers cottages now lie derelict. However more houses have been built at Kirkhill as the population of the area has become more polarised. Distilling methods have changed too, with the emphasis firmly placed more on production of quantity and less on the traditional skills of producing a quality Scotch Whisky. { { CONTINUED ON PAGE 12. }
